title: Epitaph for Aurelis Bitalis
support: Marble plaque in two joining fragments, missing the upper right corner (which was however still preserved when seen in the late 19th century by Kaibel and Mommsen). Part fo the surface is missing lower right (seemingly cut away in antiquity). The rear is finished smooth, but with a narrow margin roughly cut back along the rear of the left edge from the lower corner to c.3 cm from the top.

layout.p: Six lines, of which lines 2-6 are indented by one letter compared to line 1, with a consistent left margin. The final line is shorter with the numeral larger and roughly centred. Mommsen suggested that the age formula in lines 5-6 was a later addition, seemingly for its slightly greater irregularity.

handNote.lettering: Lunate epsilon and sigma, cursive omega, with terminations rather than serifs; use of ligatures. Delta has extended top stroke. Some curvature of longer strokes and arms.

provenanceFound._: First observed at Catania in the Collezione Coco.

provenanceObserved._: Flavio Santini, 2018-09-11, depositi Mag B, cassette 41

museum.name: Museo Archeologico Regionale Paolo Orsi
museum.description: An outstanding collection of archaeological material. The collection ranges from Siracusa and the surrounding territory (Megara Hyblaia, Akrai, Kasmenai etc) to encompass all of eastern Sicily, reaching as far as Gela and Agrigento. The ground floor covers prehistory through to the end of the Classical period. Upstairs includes Hellenistic and Roman Syracuse and a display of material from the catacombs. A gallery displaying material from Hellenistic eastern Sicily is in preparation.
